ground_truth: The male singer kneels and cradles the body of a woman as a thick mist wafts across the stage. An image suddenly appears of five-year-old Latika chasing a train, followed by an image of a very beautiful Latika in her 20s. Back on the game show, Jamal looks lost in thought, and in the director's edit suite, the video plays in the police station. Two ten-year-old brothers walk along a pipeline, and from an aerial view, they head toward the distant skyscrapers of Mumbai. The city sprawls with high-rise apartments and green parks, juxtaposed with vast slums and shanty towns. Jamal walks alone through slum streets strewn with rubbish and debris and approaches a group of men scavenging on a rubbish tip. He wanders the teeming streets of Mumbai by day and night and questions some young boys his age, who shake their heads. Walking through a crowded night market with stalls selling a thousand and one different things, he is later seen in uniform walking through a kitchen, where Salim, also in uniform, dozes on a kitchen worktop and then wakes up. Jamal descends into a subway where a blind Arvind sings and begs. Jamal stops and recognizes Arvind, digs into his pockets, finds a $100 bill, and gives it to him. Arvind feels his way from Jamal's hands up to his face and smiles. Jamal grips Arvind by the shoulders, looks happily surprised with the news, touches Arvind's face gently, and runs off along the subway as a worker starts to fumigate it. Jamal disappears running through the smoke and emerges with Salim through exhaust fumes on Pila Street at night, which is lined with brothels and where prostitutes sit on chairs on the pavement. Salim questions a woman, who shakes her head, prompting them to move on. Jamal asks another woman, who pats his cheek, while a girl in a silk costume and jewelry dances, whirling round and round. Salim and Jamal wind their way down Pila Street as women call down from balconies and open windows to men on the crowded street. Salim and Jamal question two women, who direct them to an entrance down the busy corridor. Inside, the dancing girl continues her steps under a watchful elderly male teacher who claps to maintain her tempo. Jamal and Salim walk through a brothel, pulling aside curtains covering alcoves where couples are having sex. Jamal approaches a girl, who points to a closed door. He peers through a crack in the door and sees the beautiful dancing girl, but Salim yanks Jamal away and peers through the hole himself, his eye widening in surprise.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution

An image suddenly emerges of five-year-old Latika pursuing a train, followed by an image of a very stunning Latika in her 20s. Back on the game show, Jamal appears lost in contemplation, and in the director's editing suite, the footage plays in the police station. Two ten-year-old siblings stroll along a pipeline, and from an aerial view, they head toward the distant skyscrapers of Mumbai. The metropolis sprawls with high-rise apartment buildings and green parks, juxtaposed with vast slums and shanty towns. Jamal walks alone through slum alleys strewn with trash and debris and approaches a group of men scavenging on a rubbish heap. He roams the crowded streets of Mumbai by day and night and questions some young boys his age, who shake their heads. Walking through a bustling night market with stalls vending a thousand and one different items, he is later observed in uniform walking through a kitchen, where Salim, also in uniform, dozes on a kitchen countertop and then awakens. Jamal descends into a subway where a blind Arvind croons and pleads. Jamal halts and identifies Arvind, digs into his pockets, finds a $100 note, and gives it to him. Arvind feels his way from Jamal's hands up to his face and smiles. Jamal grips Arvind by the shoulders, looks happily astonished with the information, touches Arvind's face gently, and dashes off along the subway as a worker begins to fumigate it. Jamal vanishes running through the smoke and emerges with Salim through exhaust vapors on Pila Street at night, which is lined with brothels and where prostitutes sit on chairs on the sidewalk. Salim questions a woman, who shakes her head, prompting them to proceed. Jamal asks another woman, who pats his cheek, while a girl in a silk outfit and jewelry dances, twirling round and round. Salim and Jamal wind their way down Pila Street as women call down from balconies and open windows to men on the crowded street. Salim and Jamal question two women, who direct them to an entrance down the busy passage. Inside, the dancing girl continues her routine under a watchful elderly male instructor who claps to maintain her rhythm. Jamal and Salim walk through a brothel, pulling aside drapes covering alcoves where pairs are having intercourse. Jamal approaches a girl, who points to a closed door. He peers through a crack in the door and sees the gorgeous dancing girl, but Salim tugs Jamal away and peers through the gap himself, his eye widening in astonishment.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The body of a woman is cradled by the male singer, and a thick mist is wafted across the stage. Five-year-old Latika is suddenly depicted in an image, chasing a train, followed by Latika in her 20s, who is depicted as very beautiful. On the game show, Jamal is looked at as if lost in thought, and the video is played in the police station by the director in the edit suite. A pipeline is walked along by two ten-year-old brothers, and they are seen heading toward the distant skyscrapers of Mumbai from an aerial view. High-rise apartments and green parks are sprawled with by the city, juxtaposed with slums and shanty towns that are vast. Through slum streets strewn with rubbish and debris, Jamal is walked alone by him, and a group of men scavenging on a rubbish tip is approached. By day and night, the teeming streets of Mumbai are wandered by him, and some young boys his age are questioned, who shake their heads. He is seen later walking through a crowded night market with stalls selling a thousand and one different things, and he walks through a kitchen in uniform, where Salim, also in uniform, is dozing on a kitchen worktop and then wakes up. A subway is descended into by Jamal where Arvind, who is blind, sings and begs. Arvind is recognized by Jamal, who digs into his pockets, finds a $100 bill, and it is given to Arvind by him. Jamal's hands are felt from by Arvind up to his face, and he smiles. Arvind is gripped by the shoulders by Jamal, who looks happily surprised with the news, touches Arvind's face gently, and takes off running along the subway as fumigation is started by a worker. Jamal emerges with Salim through exhaust fumes on Pila Street at night, as he disappears running through the smoke, where brothels line the street and prostitutes sit on chairs on the pavement. A woman is questioned by Salim, who shakes her head, prompting them to continue on. Another woman is asked by Jamal, who pats his cheek, while a girl is seen dancing in a silk costume and jewelry, whirling round and round. Down Pila Street, Salim and Jamal wind their way as women call down from balconies and open windows to men on the crowded street. Two women are questioned by Salim and Jamal, who direct them to an entrance down the busy corridor. Under a watchful elderly male teacher who claps to maintain her tempo, the dancing girl continues her steps inside. Through a brothel, Salim and Jamal walk, pulling aside curtains covering alcoves where couples are having sex. A girl is approached by Jamal, who points to a closed door. Through a crack in the door, he peers and sees the beautiful dancing girl, but Jamal is yanked away by Salim, who peers through the hole himself, his eye widening in surprise.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The male singer kneels and holds a woman as a thick mist drifts across the stage. An image appears of young Latika chasing a train, followed by Latika in her 20s. During the game show, Jamal appears deep in thought, while the director's suite plays the video at the police station. Two ten-year-old brothers walk along a pipeline toward the distant skyscrapers of Mumbai, a city of high-rises and green parks contrasted with vast slums. Jamal walks through slum streets filled with debris, approaching men scavenging on a rubbish tip. He roams the bustling streets of Mumbai day and night, questioning boys who shake their heads. In a crowded night market, Jamal, later in uniform, walks through a kitchen where Salim dozes on a worktop. Jamal encounters blind Arvind in a subway, gives him a $100 bill, and is surprised at Arvind's response. Jamal runs through the smoke-filled subway, emerging with Salim on Pila Street lined with brothels. They question women, and a dancing girl in silk and jewelry catches their attention. Directed by two women, Salim and Jamal enter a busy corridor where an elderly teacher oversees the dancing girl. They navigate a brothel, pulling curtains aside, and Jamal sees the dancing girl through a door crack. Salim pulls him away to peer through the hole, his eyes widening in shock.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The male singer kneels, cradling a woman's body as mist wafts across the stage. Images of five-year-old Latika chasing a train and a beautiful Latika in her 20s appear. On the game show, Jamal looks lost in thought. Ten-year-old brothers walk toward Mumbai's skyscrapers, a city of high-rises, parks, slums, and shantytowns. Jamal walks alone through slum streets, questioning young boys. In a crowded night market, he walks in uniform through a kitchen where Salim, also in uniform, dozes. Jamal gives a $100 bill to blind Arvind, who smiles upon recognizing him. Jamal, happily surprised, runs through the subway as it is fumigated, then emerges with Salim on Pila Street, lined with brothels and prostitutes. They question women, who direct them to an entrance where a girl dances under a teacher's watch. Jamal and Salim move through a brothel, pulling curtains aside, and Jamal peers through a door crack. Salim pulls him away to look himself, eyes widening in surprise.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The male singer, with great emotion and tenderness, kneels down on the stage and gently cradles the body of a woman as a thick, swirling mist wafts mysteriously across the stage, setting an ethereal atmosphere. Suddenly, an image appears, capturing the innocence of a five-year-old Latika as she energetically chases after a train, and this is followed by another poignant image of Latika, now transformed into a very beautiful young woman in her 20s. Back on the tense set of the game show, Jamal appears lost in his own deep thoughts, while in the director's edit suite, the video continues to play in the bustling police station. Meanwhile, two ten-year-old brothers are seen walking steadily along a pipeline, and from an impressive aerial perspective, they can be observed making their way toward the distant, towering skyscrapers of the sprawling city of Mumbai. The cityscape spreads out before them in a contrasting panorama of high-rise apartments and lush green parks, juxtaposed sharply with the vast slums and shantytowns. 

Jamal walks solitary through the slum streets, which are heavily strewn with rubbish and various debris, and he approaches a group of men who are busily scavenging on a rubbish tip. He continues his journey, wandering through the teeming streets of the vibrant city of Mumbai by both day and night, questioning some young boys around his age, who simply shake their heads in response. As he walks through a crowded and bustling night market, with stalls overflowing with a thousand and one varied things for sale, he is later seen in a smart uniform walking through an industrious kitchen. There, Salim, also dressed in uniform, is found dozing on a kitchen worktop but then wakes up. Jamal then descends into a dimly lit subway, where a blind man named Arvind sings and begs for help. Jamal stops, recognizing Arvind, and digs into his pockets, finding a $100 bill, which he generously gives to him. Arvind, with great care, feels his way from Jamal's hands up to his face and smiles warmly. Jamal, filled with sudden joy, grips Arvind by the shoulders, appearing happily surprised with the news, gently touches Arvind’s face, and then dashes off along the subway as a worker begins to fumigate it. Jamal runs through the thick smoke and emerges with Salim through the exhaust fumes on Pila Street at night, a street lined with brothels where prostitutes are seated on chairs on the pavement. 

Salim questions a woman, who shakes her head in response, prompting them to continue on their search. Jamal asks another woman, who gently pats his cheek, while nearby, a girl dressed in a silk costume and sparkling jewelry dances, gracefully whirling round and round. Salim and Jamal weave their way down Pila Street as women call enticingly down from the balconies and open windows to the men on the crowded street below. Salim and Jamal question two women, who then direct them down to an entrance further along the busy corridor. Inside this entrance, the dancing girl continues her intricate steps under the watchful eye of an elderly male teacher, who claps rhythmically to maintain her tempo. Jamal and Salim make their way through the brothel, pulling aside heavy curtains that cover alcoves where couples are engaged in intimate activities. Jamal approaches a girl, who silently points toward a closed door. He peeks through a small crack in the door and sees the beautiful dancing girl, but Salim abruptly yanks Jamal away and peers through the hole with his own eye widening in astonishment at what he sees.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The male singer, displaying an immense depth of emotion and genuine tenderness, gracefully kneels down on the stage, tenderly cradling the body of a woman in his arms. All around him, a thick and swirling mist unfurls mysteriously across the stage, creating an ethereal atmosphere that envelops the scene in mystery. Suddenly, an evocative image emerges, showing the innocent figure of a five-year-old Latika as she energetically gives chase to a speeding train. This poignant image is swiftly followed by another striking visual of Latika, who has now matured into a stunningly beautiful young woman in her twenties. Back in the tense environment of the game show set, Jamal appears deeply absorbed in his own thoughts. Meanwhile, in the bustling director’s edit suite, the video continues to play on, finding its audience in the busy police station. Elsewhere, two ten-year-old brothers can be seen walking steadily along a massive pipeline. From an impressive aerial perspective, they are observed making their way toward the distant, towering skyscrapers that define the sprawling metropolis of Mumbai. The cityscape stretches out before them as a contrasting panorama, combining high-rise apartments and lush green parks with the vast, haphazard spread of slums and shantytowns.

Jamal walks alone and unaccompanied through the slum streets, which are heavily littered with rubbish and various forms of debris. He approaches a group of men who are busily scavenging in the midst of a rubbish tip. Continuing on his solitary journey, he wanders through the teeming streets of the vibrant and bustling city of Mumbai, both by the light of day and the cover of night. Along the way, he questions some young boys around his age, who simply shake their heads in silent response. As night falls, he moves through a crowded and lively night market, where stalls are overflowing with a thousand and one different items for sale. Later, he is seen dressed in a smart uniform, walking through a busy kitchen bustling with activity. There, he finds Salim, also clad in uniform, dozing on a kitchen worktop until he wakes up with a start. Jamal then descends into a dimly lit subway filled with shadows, where a blind man named Arvind sings and begs for aid. Jamal stops in recognition of Arvind, reaching into his pockets and finding a $100 bill, which he generously offers to him. Arvind, with deliberate care, feels his way from Jamal's hands up to his face, offering a warm and appreciative smile. Jamal, suddenly filled with joy, grips Arvind by the shoulders, appearing happily surprised by news, gently touches Arvind’s face, and then dashes off swiftly along the subway as a worker, clad in protective gear, begins the process of fumigating it. Jamal runs through the dense smoke and emerges alongside Salim through the exhaust fumes on Pila Street at night, where the street is lined with brothels, and prostitutes are seated on chairs on the pavement, observing passersby.

Salim questions a woman, who responds by shaking her head, prompting them to continue their ongoing search. Jamal asks another woman, who gently pats his cheek in a gesture of kindness. Nearby, a girl adorned in a silk costume, with sparkling jewelry that catches the light, dances gracefully, whirling round and round with practiced ease. Salim and Jamal weave their way down Pila Street, as women enticingly call down from balconies and open windows to the men ambling along the crowded street below. Salim and Jamal question two women, who then direct them further down the busy corridor to an entrance. Inside this entrance, the dancing girl continues her intricate steps, performing under the watchful eye of an elderly male teacher, who claps his hands rhythmically to help her maintain her tempo. Jamal and Salim make their way with determination through the brothel, pulling aside heavy curtains that conceal alcoves where couples are engaged in intimate activities. Jamal approaches a girl, who silently points toward a closed door. He peers through a small crack in the door and catches sight of the beautiful dancing girl. However, Salim suddenly pulls Jamal away and looks through the hole himself, his eye widening in astonishment at the sight that greets him.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The male singer gracefully lowers himself to his knees and tenderly cradles the lifeless body of a woman in his arms, all while a thick mist gently flows across the stage, creating an eerie and poignant atmosphere. As the scene unfolds, an image abruptly materializes on the screen, depicting a five-year-old Latika energetically chasing after a moving train, and this is soon followed by another image showing a strikingly beautiful Latika in her twenties. Meanwhile, back in the intense environment of the game show, Jamal appears lost in contemplation, his eyes distant as he drifts into his thoughts. Concurrently, in the director's edit suite, a video plays on a screen located in the police station, adding to the narrative backdrop. In another scene, two ten-year-old brothers navigate their way along a sprawling pipeline, and from a bird's-eye view, they can be seen moving purposefully toward the towering skyscrapers of Mumbai that loom on the horizon. The city beneath them spreads out in a complex tapestry of towering high-rise apartments and lush green parks, starkly contrasted by the sprawling vastness of slums and makeshift shanty towns. Jamal, on a solitary journey, walks through the narrow streets of a slum, where garbage and debris are scattered about, and approaches a group of men busy scavenging on a rubbish tip. He then meanders through the bustling streets of Mumbai, experiencing the city both in the glaring light of day and the muted shadows of night. Along his path, he pauses to engage with some young boys his age, who respond to his questions with shakes of their heads. Later, as he threads his way through a crowded night market, he is surrounded by stalls brimming with a dizzying array of goods. In a subsequent scene, he is seen dressed in a uniform, walking through a bustling kitchen where Salim, also in uniform, is lying on a kitchen worktop, comfortably dozing until he is gently roused from his sleep. Jamal then descends into the dimly lit depths of a subway, where he encounters Arvind, a blind man who sings and begs for alms. Recognizing Arvind, Jamal halts, digs into his pockets, retrieves a $100 bill, and hands it to him. Arvind, in turn, delicately traces his fingers from Jamal's hands up to his face and smiles warmly. Feeling a surge of emotion, Jamal clasps Arvind by the shoulders and, with an expression of delightful surprise, touches Arvind's face tenderly before dashing off through the subway. As he runs, a worker begins to fumigate the area, and Jamal vanishes into the swirling smoke, only to reappear with Salim amidst the exhaust fumes on the night-shrouded Pila Street. The street is lined with brothels, with prostitutes sitting on chairs along the pavement. Salim approaches a woman and questions her, but she merely shakes her head, prompting the pair to move on. Jamal then poses a question to another woman, who responds by affectionately patting his cheek. Nearby, a girl adorned in a silk costume and embellished with jewelry spins gracefully, dancing in joyful whirls. Salim and Jamal continue to weave their way down Pila Street as women lean out from balconies and call to men navigating the crowded thoroughfare below. The brothers approach two women who, in response to their inquiries, direct them toward an entrance that leads down a bustling corridor. Within the structure, the dancing girl continues to perform her steps, all under the vigilant gaze of an elderly male teacher, who claps rhythmically to ensure she maintains her tempo. Jamal and Salim proceed through a brothel, gingerly pulling aside curtains that conceal alcoves where couples engage in intimate acts. As they move, Jamal approaches a girl, who discreetly points toward a closed door. He carefully peers through a narrow crack in the door and catches sight of the beautiful dancing girl, only to be abruptly pulled away by Salim, who then takes his turn peering through the same hole, his eye widening in amazement at the sight beyond.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The male singer kneels, cradling a woman's body as mist envelops the stage. Images flash by of five-year-old Latika chasing a train, followed by a vision of Latika in her 20s. On the game show set, Jamal seems lost in thought while, in the director's suite, the video plays at the police station. Two ten-year-old brothers traverse a pipeline toward Mumbai's distant skyscrapers, a city sprawling with modern apartments alongside vast slums. Jamal navigates alone through slum streets filled with debris, approaches scavengers at a rubbish tip, and wanders Mumbai's bustling streets, questioning young boys his age to no avail. After passing through a vibrant night market, he is seen in a kitchen wearing a uniform, where Salim dozes and then wakes. In a subway, Jamal encounters a blind singer, Arvind, and gives him a $100 bill. Arvind recognizes Jamal by touch and smiles, prompting Jamal to leave joyfully as a subway worker begins fumigation. Jamal vanishes into the smoke, reappearing with Salim through exhaust fumes on Pila Street, a place lined with brothels and seated prostitutes. After questioning several women, who mostly shake their heads, they continue down the street, dodging calls from balconies. Directed by two women, they enter a busy corridor leading to an older man maintaining a dancing girl's rhythm. Jamal and Salim make their way through the brothel, peering into closed spaces and eventually spotting the beautiful dancer, which prompts Salim to excitedly peer through a door's crack after pulling Jamal away.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The male singer, part of a dramatic theater troupe known for their emotionally intense performances, kneels and cradles the body of a woman as a thick mist wafts across the stage, created by a smoke machine for atmospheric effect. An image suddenly appears of five-year-old Latika, a character known for her resilience, chasing a train, symbolizing a frantic attempt to escape from a difficult situation, followed by an image of a very beautiful Latika in her 20s, highlighting her transformation over the years. Back on the popular Indian game show "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?", Jamal looks lost in thought, and in the director’s edit suite, the video plays in the police station, where officers scrutinize his every move, suspecting foul play. Two ten-year-old brothers, characters reminiscent of the author Vikas Swarup's novel "Q & A", from which the film draws inspiration, walk along a pipeline, and from an aerial view, they head toward the distant skyscrapers of Mumbai, a city known for its stark contrasts and rapid urbanization. The city sprawls with high-rise apartments and green parks, juxtaposed with vast slums and shanty towns, vividly illustrating the socioeconomic disparity. Jamal walks alone through slum streets strewn with rubbish and debris, portraying the harsh realities of life, and approaches a group of men scavenging on a rubbish tip, a common survival method for many impoverished residents. He wanders the teeming streets of Mumbai by day and night, a city that never sleeps, and questions some young boys his age, who shake their heads, uninterested or unaware. Walking through a crowded night market with stalls selling a thousand and one different things, from spices to electronics, he is later seen in uniform walking through a kitchen, where Salim, also in uniform, dozes on a kitchen worktop working long hours in a local restaurant, and then wakes up. Jamal descends into a subway, one of the many overused public transport facilities in Mumbai, where a blind beggar named Arvind sings and begs, using his talent to eke out a living. Jamal stops and recognizes Arvind, digs into his pockets, finds a $100 bill, a small fortune in this context, and gives it to him. Arvind feels his way from Jamal’s hands up to his face and smiles, recognizing the kindness of an old friend. Jamal grips Arvind by the shoulders, looks happily surprised with the news that Latika might be closer than he thought, touches Arvind's face gently, and runs off along the subway as a worker starts to fumigate it, an effort to combat the city's persistent sanitation issues. Jamal disappears running through the smoke and emerges with Salim through exhaust fumes on Pila Street, a notorious area at night, which is lined with brothels and where prostitutes sit on chairs on the pavement, plying their trade under the dim streetlights. Salim questions a woman, who shakes her head, prompting them to move on in their search for Latika. Jamal asks another woman, who pats his cheek sympathetically while a girl in a silk costume and jewelry, reminiscent of traditional Indian attire, dances, whirling round and round, performing for the patrons. Salim and Jamal wind their way down Pila Street as women call down from balconies and open windows to men on the crowded street, a lively yet perilous environment. Salim and Jamal question two women, who direct them to an entrance down the busy corridor, a labyrinth of sin and secrecy. Inside, the dancing girl continues her steps under a watchful elderly male teacher, possibly a former performer himself, who claps to maintain her tempo, ensuring she stays in rhythm. Jamal and Salim walk through a brothel, pulling aside curtains covering alcoves where couples are having sex, a raw depiction of the area's reality. Jamal approaches a girl, who points to a closed door, indicating where they might find who they’re looking for. He peers through a crack in the door and sees the beautiful dancing girl, Latika, whose presence has been at the heart of their search, but Salim yanks Jamal away and peers through the hole himself, his eye widening in surprise at the sight of her elegance and circumstance.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Jamal grips Arvind by the shoulders looks happily surprised with the news touches. Arvind's face gently and runs off along the subway as a worker starts to fumigate it. Jamal disappears running through the smoke and emerges with Salim through exhaust fumes on Pila Street at night which is lined with brothels and where prostitutes sit on chairs on the pavement. Salim questions a woman who shakes her head prompting them to move on. Jamal asks another woman who pats his cheek while a girl in a silk costume and jewelry dances whirling round and round. Salim and Jamal wind their way down Pila Street as women call down from balconies and open windows to men on the crowded street. Salim and Jamal question two women who direct them to an entrance down the busy corridor. Inside the dancing girl continues her steps under a watchful elderly male teacher who claps to maintain her tempo. Jamal and Salim walk through a brothel pulling aside curtains covering alcoves where couples are having sex. Jamal approaches a girl who points to a closed door. He peers through a crack in the door and sees the beautiful dancing girl but Salim yanks Jamal away and peers through the hole. himself his eye widening in surprise.

An image suddenly appears of fiveyearold Latika chasing a train followed by an image of a very beautiful Latika in her 20s. Back on the game show Jamal looks lost in thought and in the director's edit suite the video plays in the police station. Two tenyearold brothers walk along a pipeline and from an aerial view they head toward the distant skyscrapers of Mumbai. The city sprawls with highrise apartments and green parks juxtaposed with vast slums and shanty towns. Jamal walks alone through slum streets strewn with rubbish and debris and approaches a group of men scavenging on a rubbish tip. Salim and Jamal question two women who direct them to an entrance down the busy corridor. Inside the dancing girl continues her steps under a watchful elderly male teacher who claps to maintain her tempo. Jamal and Salim walk through a brothel pulling aside curtains covering alcoves where couples are having sex. Jamal approaches a girl who points to a closed door. He peers through a crack in the door and sees the beautiful dancing girl but Salim yanks Jamal away and peers through the hole. himself his eye widening in surprise.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The elderly poet crouches and holds the sculpture of a cat as a gentle breeze flows over the mountain. A painting suddenly emerges of young Charlie pursuing a boat, followed by a painting of a very large Charlie in her 50s. Back at the library, Alex seems consumed in boredom, and in the artist's workshop, the sculpture sits in the fire station. Two teenage sisters skip along a sidewalk, and from a satellite angle, they drift toward the distant pyramids of Cairo. The village stretches with modest cottages and lush gardens, contrasted with vast deserts and sand dunes. Alex skips alone through alleyways covered with confetti and stamps and approaches a crowd of women dancing on a sand dune. He roams the bustling alleys of Cairo by dusk and dawn and inquires some old men his size, who nod their chins. Skipping through a deserted morning fair with booths displaying a hundred and one identical items, he is later noticed in disguise skipping through a garage, where Max, also in disguise, naps on a garage floor and then jumps up. Alex climbs into a tunnel where a sighted Oliver hums and eats. Alex pauses and identifies Oliver, digs into his backpack, discovers a chocolate bar, and hands it to him. Oliver traces his fingers from Alex's backpack up to his nose and grins. Alex grips Oliver by the elbows, looks blissfully astonished with the information, pats Oliver's beard gently, and skips away inside the tunnel as a machine begins to mend it. Alex vanishes skipping within the fog and surfaces with Max through steam clouds on Maple Road at midday, which is bordered with schools and where instructors rest on benches on the tile. Max interrogates a cat, which nods its chin, encouraging them to proceed. Alex addresses another cat, which brushes his elbow, while a dog in a velvet coat and buttons glides, spinning left and right. Max and Alex weave their route up Maple Road as men shout up from rooftops and open skies to women on the narrow path. Max and Alex interrogate two cats, which guide them to a basement inside the empty corridor. Outside, the gliding dog maintains its motion under a stern youthful female coach who stomps to preserve its pace. Alex and Max skip through a gymnasium, pushing aside beads draping nooks where families are playing chess. Alex reaches a dog, which gestures to an open tunnel. He gazes through a slit in the tunnel and observes the stunning gliding dog, but Max drags Alex away and gazes through the gap himself, his paw widening in astonishment.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The male singer cradles a woman's body on stage as mist wafts around. Images flash of Latika as a child chasing a train and then as a beautiful young woman. On the game show, Jamal appears deep in thought. Two brothers walk towards Mumbai's distant skyscrapers, showcasing the city's mix of high-rises and slums. Jamal navigates the slum streets, engaging with young boys who offer no help, and wanders the bustling night market. He later meets Salim in a kitchen, then finds a blind man, Arvind, in a subway, giving him a $100 bill. Recognizing each other, they share a moment before Jamal runs off. Emerging on Pila Street, lined with brothels, Jamal and Salim search for someone. They question women, eventually finding a girl who directs them inside to a busy corridor. Inside, a dancing girl performs under an elderly teacher's watchful eye. Jamal and Salim pull aside curtains in the brothel, leading Jamal to a closed door. He peeks inside, sees the dancing girl, but Salim pulls him away to look himself, surprised by what he sees.
